Summary: tip of a giant blue fireball splits into 4 parts and converges before disappearing
trends: There have been 62 other sightings in Memphis
There were no other sightings in Memphis on or around April 26th 2008
divs: sighting detailsi was delivering a pizza and as i was walking to the house my attention was drawn to the sky by a blue\green\white flashing behind the cloud cover. out from the clouds came what could only be described as a turquoise comet in the memphis sky. it was entirely too close to actually be a comet. i was involuntarily trying to convince my self that this was a firework or something terrestrial, as i had a sighting almost a week before (also posted on the mufon database). there were sparks coming off the tail. the tail was incredibly long and fat, and it stretched across the sky. the tail was also phenomenally luminescent, i had seen its light through the clouds, and when it came from behind the cloud, it seemed to light up the whole sky. then the tip of the "comet" broke up into 4 or 5 lights with smaller tails, they danced around the small area around the original ball area of the comet and converged again before the whole thing disappeared. i could no longer rationalize what i had seen. i completed the delivery in shock, unable to stop myself from telling the customer what i had just seen in the sky behind their house. i forgot about the rest of the deliveries i had with me until i got back to the store. upon returning to my car, i saw that my girlfriend had called. she had seen the same thing from a different part of town. i was sure that other people had seen it, because its light had seemed to illuminate the whole sky, but no one i know had.
